thread.title: Guided history hike celebrates Hampstead's 275th

author: Angelina Berube
title: Guided history hike celebrates Hampstead's 275th
text:
HAMPSTEAD — The Hampstead Historical Society will continue to celebrate the town’s 275th anniversary with a guided history hike from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. July 27 at the West Road Conservation Area, West Road.
Explore the Kent and Brown farm homesteads, both of which were occupied by those families at or just after the founding of Hampstead in 1749. See multiple old cellar holes, a well hole, an animal corral, a couple of original 1749 town line markers, an oak tree from the 1700s, farm fields and the parish land.
The hike will be three miles. Sturdy, waterproof footwear and hiking poles are recommended. The hike will be approximately two hours.
Signup by July 25. Additional details will be sent the day before the hike.
For more information and to register, visit
hampsteadhistoricalsociety.org/275th-anniversary.
Early closure on Saturday
WINDHAM — The town announced the town beach and its parking lot will close at 3 p.m. Saturday and reopen at dawn on Sunday.
There will be no access to the beach or parking lot during this time.
Summer concert series continues
PLAISTOW — Plaistow Recreation will continue its summer concert series on Wednesday through Aug. 14 on the Town Green, 145 Main St.
Concerts last from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. every Wednesday.
Experience the vibrant sounds of the local music scene. Bring chairs and a picnic dinner for a night out.
Knock on Wood will perform on Wednesday.
The remaining concert lineup includes performances by the Timberlane Community Jazz Band, the Timberlane Community Band, North River Music, Relative Soul and Time Bandits.
For weather-related updates, visit
plaistow.com/recreation or check the Plaistow Recreation Department’s Facebook page.
Kingston car show Aug. 3
KINGSTON — The Friends of Kingston Historical Museum Heritage Day will hold a car show from 9 a.m. to noon Aug. 3 at Sanborn Regional High School, 17 Danville Road.
Car registration is $5 per vehicle. All makes and models welcome.
Trophies will be awarded. Registration starts at 8 a.m.
Admission is a minimum donation of $1 per person. All proceeds support the Kingston Historical Museum.
For more information, contact Heidi Corson at 603-702-1811 or email or email .
